  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24630].
  {panel}

* TO DO: Remove page "Working with the Macro Browser"
** Change the online help link, to point to "Working with Macros".
** Change all existing links in the docs.
** Add the necessary content to the page "Working with Macros" -- make it minimal.
** Add the rationale to the EAC page -- we should not document the feature, but just what people are trying to do. Also, we should allow the UI to speak for itself.

* TO DO: Convert the docs on the include macros (all 3) to task-focused, and do related updates.

* TO DO: Add to EAC page explaining the rationale of combining/deleting pages.
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/TECHWRITING/Streamlining+the+Confluence+docs+for+simple+docs+strategy
fields.summary: Rationalise macro docs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24629].
  {panel}

plugins search breaks after searching and then switching tabs

steps to reproduce:
1) go to confluence admin -> plugins
2) open system plugins
3) search for something, eg "apache"
4) click on another tab, eg the "Upgrade" tab
5) let the page load, then move back to the "Manage Existing"

notice how the list of plugins has refreshed, displaying all plugins, yet the search bar still contains "apache". the search is now broken, the only thing that you can do now is enter nonsense, eg "asdasdasd" and it will show you the "No plugins in this category match your filter." message
fields.summary: plugin search breaks when switching to another tab after performing a search
Prevent the editor growing larger than browser viewport when commenting

fields.description:
I'm reporting two bugs with this issue. The first is when I've applied image effects to an image that is left aligned and then I center align it, the image effects disappear. However, if you save or preview the page, the image effects are still intact. So the effects are just not rendered in when in edit mode.

See the video here: http://screencast.com/t/TYlWQlW7

The second is a similar problem. When I have a heading above an image with effects as the top two items on a page and I insert a line break above the heading, the cursor and text effect remains heading 1. I type Command + 1 to return to paragraph text. This causes the effects to disappear - similar to the bug described above. 

See the video: http://screencast.com/t/SjQjZFx3y
fields.summary: Image Effects in editor is lost when image is aligned L, R or C

fields.summary: Make find & replace highlight all occurrences of search string and display a count

fields.description:
In Confluence 3.5 and earlier, you could edit any type of page anchor link quite easily...

* For example, you could simply edit a page called 'This Page' with a link to an anchor on 'Some other page' by changing:
** {{\[link to anchor on another page|Some Other Page#anchorname]}}
to
** {{\[link to anchor on another page|Some Other Page#anewanchorname]}}

Afaia, Confluence 4.1+ allows you to edit links to anchors on the same page, but so far, this isn't possible with links to anchors on other pages.

Instead, you have to recreate these links 'from scratch' using the *Link* dialog box.
fields.summary: Links to anchors on other pages in Confluence 4.0+ cannot be edited.

fields.description:
When I create a new blog post the time informed is correct. But when I use the blog post macro, the time informed is incorrect.

Steps to reproduce:

- click in add >> blog post;
- after created the blog post and saved, this is the time informed: (16 and 30 minutes)
!blog_post01.jpg!
- in a new page, click in add macro and select blog post macro and save
- this is the time informed: (16 hours)
!blog_post02.jpg!
fields.summary: The blog post macro display incorrect age information on blog posts

fields.description:
h4. Problem Description
When adding 'Blog Post' macro in certain page in Confluence, you can sort it by its creation time, modified time, or title name. However, when it's sorted based on _creation_ and _Reverse Sort_ is checked, the sequence stay the same and not reversed.
!blogpost-1.png!
!blogspost-2.png!

h4. Step to Reproduce
# Create sample blog posts (Skip to #2 if any blog posts are already exists)
# Edit any page and include _*Blog Posts*_ macro.
# Select *creation* in  _Sort by_ fields.
# Click Refresh and check the sequence.
# Check *Reverse Sort* box.
# Click Refresh and notice the sequence still the same.
fields.summary: Reverse Sort by creation on 'Blog Posts' Macro doesn't work if the post created on same day
Markup/XHTML conversion fails on unicode character "U+FFFF"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24620].
  {panel}

The enclosed website / page has 3500 anchors. Our nationwide website has about 60 named links that point to respective anchors on the FR webpage. When we link to a specific anchor on the webpage, the correct anchor comes up on the display correctly, but then as the page continues to load, the correct anchor will rise or lower from view, on the display.

What we need:
# To have the link stop at the correct anchor, with the anchor at the top of the display.
# The current macro / link accepts input for the specific anchor, with the qualifier  "#p-537".

*We need the capability to display data between "From anchor","To anchor"*

When a client clicks a named link, we want the client to see only data relevant to the link name, not have to review the other 3500 anchors of data to see where his search should end.

Details:

# We link to the following web site and anchor:
http://www.federalregister.gov/articles/2010/07/28/2010-17207/medicare-and-medicaid-programs-electronic-health-record-incentive-program#p-537

# This particular link / anchor on the webpage is named:
NPRM EP/Eligible Hospital Objective: Maintain active medication allergy list
The anchor number is 537
On our web page, the link is named: Maintain Active Medication Allergy List

# As my test link, in the Rich Text editor, and on our Confluence page we see: [EvaluationLink|https://www.federalregister.gov/articles/2010/07/28/2010-17207/medicare-and-medicaid-programs-electronic-health-record-incentive-program#p-514]

# In the Wikieditor for our Confluence page, we see the link as:
 [EvaluationLink|http://www.federalregister.gov/articles/2010/07/28/2010-17207/medicare-and-medicaid-programs-electronic-health-record-incentive-program#p-537 ]

# When we click on the link:
The link goes directly to the webpage, and to the correct anchor which will be at the top of the display / screen.
But the rest of the web page is still downloading to our computer, as one can see by the messages in the lower left hand corner.
The correct anchor moves up and down several pages, while the whole page is loading

# Anchor 537 on the webpage is:
 NPRM EP/Eligible Hospital Objective: Maintain active medication allergy list
## For this particular link, we want to display the data between only anchors 537 to 559, and not download the whole page to the client, or us.

# There are about 3500 anchors on the page, we would prefer our nationwide clients, who may have limited broadband capability, not have to download the whole page, then have to search for their requested item.

# The expected updated macro would look something like this:
http://www.federalregister.gov/articles/2010/07/28/2010-17207/medicare-and-medicaid-programs-electronic-health-record-incentive-program#p-537 to #p-559
fields.summary: Provide capability to display data between "From anchor" and "To anchor"

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a Mail Server (This will make Share button available)
# Create a Chinese username e.g. 招呼你
# Rebuild search index
# Typed in username 招呼你 in the Share page field
# This will resulted in "No matching user or email found"

PS: The same result will be returned even the indexing language is set to Chinese. In Confluence 4.1, searching up Chinese username will work if the indexing language is set to Chinese.
fields.summary: Sharing page with username or email address which consists of Chinese characters will returned "No matching user or email found"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24612].
  {panel}

1)In Confluence, select a Space with a Page Tree whose list goes beyond the bottom of the screen.
2)Expand the list, scroll down and select a page.
3)After the page loads notice that the Page Tree section has defaulted back to the top.

This is a pain when I'm going down a long list of pages, inspecting them one at a time. I am forced to scroll back down to where I was, wasting precious seconds :)
fields.summary: Page Tree Reverts Back to Top After Selecting a Page

Two problems

# The icons are missing for the user/group selector
# You can assign the user by clicking the blank area but it doesn't seem to stick. I've tried everything I can think of to make this work. It just doesn't work. 

I tested this in 3.5.13 and it doesn't work there either so it seems to have been broken for a while.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24588].
  {panel}

Hi guys,

When I was creating or modifying templates before 4.0,  I used to create a page which looked the template I wanted to create, "view page in Wiki markup" and copy pasted the wiki markup text in the template editor. Few minor manuall corrections later I had the template I wanted.

Now the "view in Wiki markup"-option is gone, whilst templates still must be written in wiki markup. 

My questions: 

a) is the a way to see a page in wiki markup?

b) do you know any other workaround to solve this?

c) are you allready planning to fix the template editor, so that wiki markup is no longer neccessary?

Thank you very much in advance!

Best, 

Viktor 

PS: Several other users seen to have the same problem. See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+a+template?focusedCommentId=275188366#comment-275188366
fields.summary: Editing templates in v4

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug:
# Start up any Confluence 4.1.x instance
# Create a new page on any space
# The content of the page should have:
{noformat}
<insert Table of Contents>

Words (Heading 1)
<insert image>

Words (Heading 2)
<insert image>

Words (Heading 3)
<insert image>

Words (Heading 4)
<insert image>

Words (Heading 5) 
<insert image>

Words (Heading 6)
<insert image>
{noformat}
# Save the page
# Images will appear right after Heading 1 till Heading 5 except Heading 6 in the Table of Content (TOC) section 
|

I have tested this behavior in Confluence 4.0 and the problem was not there.
fields.summary: TOC shows images after Heading 1 till Heading 5

fields.description:
1. Navigate to Admin>Look and Feel>Layouts
2. You will see a message: "You can not customise the site look and feel while a theme is active. You must first disable the currently configured theme."
3. Type in the URL {{/admin/editdecorator.action?decoratorName=decorators/page.vmd}}
4. Observe that you can now edit page.vmd
fields.summary: Can change page decorator via url even when not available via UI

fields.description:
The JIRA remote issue link code assumes that the favicon PNG is located at {{/images/icons/favicon.png}}. This icon hasn't been updated in 4.1, however, so JIRA is displaying the old-style icon.

We need to support linking to multiple versions of Confluence, so we can't use any of the new images in /images/logo.

Although Confluence doesn't use this file anymore, it is referenced in [CONF-8247 (Favicon customization)|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-8247] so it is one of the de facto locations of the Confluence icon :)
fields.summary: /images/icons/favicon.png is not up to date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24583].
  {panel}

* Work on a draft and have it saved by confluence (BTW why there is no obvious 'Save as draft' button?? I would love to be able to choose when to save a draft and not wait for some auto magic to do it for me...)
* once auto-saved it will be in your drafts
* go to the same space and try to add another blog post. You will get notification that there is already one draft and whether you'd like to resume editing it
* hit cancel on that page and you lose the draft you had before

Suggested improvement:
* once a draft is saved and has a name, the user should never be able to delete it, except explicitly via the 'Drafts' page or any link that actually says it will delete the link. The 'cancel' button from the example above does not count as such
* users should be able to create multiple drafts in one space as long as they're given an unique name
fields.summary: Prevent users from losing hours of work on their blogs...

fields.description:
If you have an macro with the output type set to OutputType.INLINE and you specify a body type (BodyType.RICH_TEXT or BodyType.PLAIN_TEXT) then the editor will set your macro to render in BLOCK mode. * An inline macro is rendered in block mode in the editor to allow for a place to edit the body. If it was rendered inline, there would be no way to set the body. * The macro was defaulted to block so the editing experience was more "WYSIWIG". It was thought at the time that the inline macro that looked like a block macro was more confusing for a user. !screenshot.png! Shows that the test inline macro has been defaulted to BLOCK. It was expected that this macro should default to INLINE. Further, if the inline macro has been manually set to INLINE the view format of this macro still appears to be block. Storage Format: {code}

before

INLINE

test

after

{code} Note that the {{atlassian-macro-output-type}} has been set to INLINE (by selecting it from the popup menu). This is rendered on three separate lines because the because the surrounding {{

}} tags are broken around the body.
fields.summary: Inline macros with body default to block mode

fields.description:
* When I add a page from a template, and the template contains a {toc} macro, the {toc} macro in the template remains plain text and does not convert to the {toc} placeholder in my wiki page.

* When I add a {toc} macro to my wiki page via Insert > Wiki Markup, the {toc} macro remains plain text and does not convert to the {toc} placeholder in my wiki page.
fields.summary: {toc} macro doesn't convert when added to a page via a template or Insert > Wiki Markup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24577].
  {panel}

We have JIRA integrated with Confluence. With that we can insert JIRA issues into Confluence and see some of the fields associated with the issue in Confluence as well. One thing we still can't see is SVN log associated with the JIRA issue. It'll make the integration even more helpful if this information can be displayed as well.

Creating on behalf of vivian.zhang@huawei.com in relation to support tickets 
[CSP-76058|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-76058]
[CSP-75976|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-75976]
fields.summary: Insert SVN log associated with JIRA issue in Confluence

fields.description: This macro used to work fine in 3.5.7, with firefox 3 or 6. Now, after upgrading to Confluence 4.1.4, the macro only works with Firefox 3, and Firefox 6 gets a blank page. Flickers a bit and then nothing, blank instead of the Powerpoint file
fields.summary: The "office powerpoint macro" doesn't seem to work with Firefox 6.

fields.description:
I am attempting to use form-fill fields in Confluence Global Templates, but the feature does not work when the field is not surrounded by spaces.

See https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/28402/auto-format-a-confluence-link-in-a-template?page=1#33240

This should work consistently no matter where the @VAR@ appears - if someone wants a literal @, they should enter @@ or \@ or something.

The primary use case here is to support parametrizable links and other features where an editable string of text is embedded in a longer string.
fields.summary: Confluence template form-fill feature does not work when fields aren't surrounded by spaces

  {panel}

In jira you have only 3 levels to model your project system.
So for our business projects we used:
 jira projects to model programs, 
 issues for projects 
 and sub-tasks for project tasks like business requirements

The ability to create jira sub-tasks in confluence would be very usefull,specially for large projects, since we create requirements documentation in confluence and we could create the requirements fastly in jira as well without leaving confluence.
Thank you

fields.description:
In Confluence 3.5.x and earlier, it was possible to search a space or site for macro parameters, URLs in links, and other markup elements, because they were part of the wiki markup and thus part of the page content. This is no longer possible in Confluence 4.

*Root cause: Metadata (parameters) for content elements is hidden from the global search.*

Problem specification:
* While it is possible to search for macro names using the macroName search field, this functionality is obscure, and the usage of that field is tricky. See "How to search Confluence for usage of a macro": http://ffeathers.wordpress.com/2011/11/04/how-to-search-confluence-for-usage-of-a-macro/
* It is not possible to search for macro parameters.
** This means, for example, that you cannot discover where a particular excerpt or page is included into another page (CONF-23775). Scenario: I want to remove a page or update its content, but I need to find out first where it is included into another page.
** Another scenario: I have changed a page name, and now I need to fix all the macros that refer to that page. Note that Confluence will fix links, but not the page names inside macros. Examples of macros that need fixing: children, excerpt, excerpt-include, anchor, pagetree, pagetreesearch, plus any number of user macros and macros added by plugins.
* It is not possible to search for URLs used in links (CONF-24079). Scenario: Our website has moved to a different server and we want to fix all the links in the documentation that point to our website.
* It is not possible to find all the pages that use a given image (or other attachment). You can search for attachments by filename using the filename field, but you can't search for their usage. For example, I can find out where "myImage.png" is attached to a page, but I cannot find all the pages that display "myImage.png". Scenario: I want to remove/update a screenshot, but first I need to know where it's used. Note that this problem is made even more urgent by the fact that the Confluence editor now links to the original source of an image, if you copy content from one page to another by copying and pasting.

Please refer to the following comments on our customer feedback pages:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.0+Editor+-+Customer+Feedback?focusedCommentId=271944755#comment-271944755
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.0+Editor+-+Customer+Feedback?focusedCommentId=272597237#comment-272597237
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.0+Editor+-+Customer+Feedback?focusedCommentId=272597238#comment-272597238
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.0+Editor+-+Customer+Feedback?focusedCommentId=272597259#comment-272597259
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.0+Editor+-+Customer+Feedback?focusedCommentId=272597304#comment-272597304
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.0+Editor+-+Customer+Feedback?focusedCommentId=273285457#comment-273285457
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.0+Editor+-+Customer+Feedback?focusedCommentId=273285792#comment-273285792
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.0+Editor+-+Customer+Feedback?focusedCommentId=273285799#comment-273285799
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+4.0+Editor+-+Customer+Feedback?focusedCommentId=274563818#comment-274563818

Note: This issue is about the Confluence search function, not the search within the editor. For similar issues related to search within the editor, please see CONF-23560, CONF-23561, CONF-23667.
fields.summary: Confluence search is broken for data within content elements, such as URLs in links, parameters in macros, image names on pages

fields.description:
If two users make simultaneous edits to the same page, the option to merge isn't always presented. Instead, one of the two pages will show a conflict with the entire other page and therefore not have the option to merge.

To reproduce:
# User 1 opens page for editing in Confluence and make minor edits in one section
time passes...
# User 2 opens page for editing, sees message that User 1 is editing, then makes unrelated edits in another area of page
# User 1 saves _before_ the message about User 2 editing appears
# User 2 attempts to save, and is then presented with a listing that appears that User 1 made *many* more changes than they actually did. No option is given to merge.
fields.summary: Option to merge changes not given under certain circumstances

fields.description:
A blog post was created on a personal space.  The blog post contains content and attachments.  The personal space does not have anonymous view space permissions.  The include-blog macro was used to include the blog post from the personal space into a blog-post on a global space that does have a space permission for Anonymous view.  

An anonymous user was able to see the contents of the blog-post from the personal space that was included using the include-blog macro on the global space.  However, the anonymous user was not able to see the attachments.

When the anonymous user tried to access the blog-post directly on the personal space they were directed to the login screen and forced to login.
fields.summary: Anonymous Viewer able to see Blog Post on Space Not Open to Anonymous via include-blog-post macro

fields.description:
Confluence startup fails with error messages in catalina.out similar to:
{code:none}
2012-02-02 08:00:18,672 INFO [main] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] contextInitialized Starting Confluence 4.1.3 (build #3129)
02.02.2012 08:02:17 org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext start
SCHWERWIEGEND: Error listenerStart
02.02.2012 08:02:17 org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext start
SCHWERWIEGEND: Context [] startup failed due to previous errors

[...]

log4j:ERROR Error occured while converting date.
java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}

This seems to be caused by additional VIEWs created by us for customized features. During startup Confluence 4.x - different to previous versions - runs the statement
{code:sql}
mysql> SELECT distinct ENGINE FROM information_schema.TABLES where TABLE_SCHEMA = "confluence";
+--------+
| ENGINE |
+--------+
| InnoDB |
| NULL   |
+--------+
{code}
against the database and their seems to be no suitable error handling for the NULL value in the result set (VIEWs have this in the ENGINE and some more other fields in that table).
fields.summary: Startup fails with VIEWS in MySQL database

fields.description:
I created a plugin with a theme module which contained more than 14 resource files. Loading pages containing a code block cause multiple JS errors in ie8.

Reducing number of resources files in theme module to a maximum of 14 seemed to solve the problem.

Used:
com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin (version 2.0.10)

(Strangely these errors occur only on some pages, so please contact me if you need an example page as XML file)

Edit: After some testing with 15 resource files, no problem was found on normal pages, but the error occured on pages with code blocks in comments. Reducing theme resources to 14 filed worked.

Edit2: Digging further into that matter, I think all resources of all plugins involved into rendering a page are counted. Adding different macros from different plugins (code macro, task list, ...) lower the number of resources files I can put into my theme module.
fields.summary: More than 14 resources in theme plugin cause error in IE8

fields.description:
This has been cross-posted at [ADVMACROS-231|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/ADVMACROS-231]/

When you have blog posts macro with content parameter sets to titles, it shows wrong blogpost creation time for blogposts that were created like within 1-2 days. More than 2 days old blogposts will just show the date which is correct. But when it needs to show the time, it will somehow assume every blogposts are created at 00:00, hence the error. In the other hand, recently updated macro shows the correct timing.

Take a look at this screenshots:
This is the original blogposts creation time - 16:55:
!ori_blogpost_creation_time.png!

Blog posts macro thinks it was created 17hours (16:55) ago:
!blogpost_macro_shows_wrong_creation_time.png!
fields.summary: blog-posts macro with content-titles shows wrong blogpost creation time for 1-2 days old blogposts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24558].
  {panel}

I just hit this issue a few mins ago: 

# Need to delete a page on the integration space
# Realised I don't have access
# So I need to contact space admin... so I ask Shihab, thinking he is space admin .. and he isn't... so I ask around - a few people don't know who is...
# My solution: Have to talk to IT and ask them to tell me who is admin, then I sort my problem out.

Customers have solved this manually by:

# Creating a page that actas like a "space directory"
# For every space, they manually use the User List Macro to render all the users in the respective space-admin group.

Goal: Make it easy to discover who the space admins are for a space

This is the exact same model as the JIRA project listing - you can see who the admin is (And contact them manually) if you have an issue. To do this, we should:

*  Add a "Space Administrator(s)" column to the space directory that lists the names of users (we can set a hard-limit to the number and do a ... if there are heaps.
* In Browse > Advanced also add the space admins here with the other space metadata.
fields.summary: Make space admins discoverable to a user

fields.description:

To access the space admin area you'd have to build the URL

https://confluence/spaces/editspace.action?key=KEY

on your own.
fields.summary: Deleted Homepage -> No Link to Space-Admin in "Browse"

fields.description:
h4. Description
Whenever user click on any blank area while they are editing long page on Confluence. Firefox 3.6.x will automatically scroll up to the editor to the beginning of the page. The pointer seems to be pointed correctly, but the screens scrolled up automatically(Reproducible at [sandbox|http://sandbox.onconfluence.com/display/DEV/Bug+for+firefox+3.16])

h4. Step to reproduce
# Edit long page
# Scroll down
# Click on any empty area (not a sentence or letter)
# The browser will automatically bring the editor to the beginning of the page.

h4. Workaround
Instead of clicking it on blank area, click it on word or sentence.
fields.summary: Editor keeps scrolling up on Firefox 3.6

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24552].
  {panel}

When I am adding labels to a page, I often get this after I submit them:

You tried to add 21 labels. You can only add 20 labels at a time.

That's fine, I guess, but then it doesn't give me a chance to go back and edit my list.  I have to start from scratch, which is very annoying.

I suggest you #1.) allow adding unlimited labels, or #2.) if that's not possible, maybe an increase to that seemingly-arbitrary limit, and #3.) and probably most-important, allow me to go back and edit the list of labels that I just typed in in order to make it shorter.
fields.summary: Label Limit of 20?  Why Can't I Go Back?

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24550].
  {panel}

On instances with a number of spaces above a certain threshold you can only create a blog post (from the dashboard gadget) in a space from your favourites. There should be an easy way to create posts in arbitrary spaces.

Two suggestions I have are:
* Frotherise the select menu
* Add a link to a page which lists all spaces you have edit permissions in and allows you to create a space from there.

I should mention that I'm quite familiar with Confluence and it took me a while to figure out I had to first navigate to the desired space before creating the post. People less familiar will have even more trouble.
fields.summary: No easy way to create a blog post in an arbitrary space from the dashboard

fields.description:
1. Access Confluence without logging in
2. Open an article
3. Click "Add comment"
4. Enter the comment
5. Enter invalid captcha word
6. Press Save
The comment box will expand to the whole screen and the rest of the buttons will become unaccessible.

fields.description:
We have two Problems with excerpt macro:

1.) The excerpt information is missing in the column 'Excerpt' when unsing the Confluence Metadata Plugin 2 --> {metadata-report}


2.) When using excerpt macro as part of an user macro, the children macro is not able to display these excerpts.

Example:
We created an user macro, called 'subject', to use it as head of every page.
It countains a panel including an excerpt, followed by a table of contents and a horizontal rule.

Here's the code for Confluence 4.x:
{code}
## @param toc:title=create table of contents|type=boolean|desc=Show a table of contents|required=false|default=false|option-showNameInPlaceholder=false

<ac:macro ac:name="panel">
  <ac:rich-text-body>
    <ac:macro ac:name="excerpt">
      <ac:parameter ac:name="atlassian-macro-output-type">BLOCK</ac:parameter>
      <ac:rich-text-body>$body</ac:rich-text-body>
    </ac:macro>
  </ac:rich-text-body>
</ac:macro>

#if ($paramtoc)
<ac:macro ac:name="toc">
  <!-- <ac:parameter ac:name="printable">false</ac:parameter> -->
</ac:macro>
<hr />
#end
{code}

With Conflunce 3.5.x an older that worked all fine.
But not with v4.1.3 :-(

I also tested it with Confluence 4.0.x (for productive use, we have skipped this version) --> Same problem!
fields.summary: content of excerpt macro is missing in some other macros
Unable to delete tasklist items. Can only delete them from wiki markup editor. using conf 3.5.5

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24540].
{panel}
h3. Summary of The Bug

When page title have any character after a colon( : )
{code:java}
Office Connector:test
{code}
office connector can't find the office files attached to the page. If colon is the last character on the page title, attached office files searchable by view office macro.

This bug also affects the multimedia macros (adding audio / video files).
h3. How to reproduce the bug
 # Create a page (example: 'Office connector:')
 !Officepage.png|thumbnail!
 # Attached office file into the page
 !attached.png|thumbnail!
 # Try to view it using view office plugin
 !Works.png|thumbnail!
 # Change the page title to contain any character after colon (example: 'Office connector:test')
 !test.png|thumbnail!
 # Try to view it using view office plugin
 !broke.png|thumbnail!
 # Attached files can't be seen on "File Name" fields
 (i) When viewed with _Developer Tools_, the {{attachmentsearch.action}} GET request returned HTTP 404 error code.

h3. Workarounds

Option 1 - Rename the page to remove the ':'

Option 2 - Use the insert markup feature:
 # From the editor toolbar, expand the '+' menu.
 # Choose 'Markup'.
 # Insert the following markup (change accordingly):
{code:java}
{viewfile:name_of_the_attachments.ext}
{code}

 # Save

h1. Work performed
 * Changes are backwards-compatible in the plugin, committed in [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/officeconnector] issue/CONF-24540 . 2 backwards-compatibility issues were raised: CONFDEV-10156 and CONFDEV-10157.
 * Changes in confluence-core are still on issue/CONF-24540, and awaiting implementation of a few review comments before being committed.
fields.summary: Viewfile macro can't find attachment if the page title contain character after colon (:)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24536].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
(You will need to do the page creation steps in a non-IE8 browser if CONFDEV-6815 is not yet fixed)
* Create a page, add in a two-column layout. 
* In the first column, type some text and add in an image and table.
* Save the page

(Now you can switch to IE8)
* Position the cursor at the top of the page layout cell, and hit tab.
You will see the image get selected and then then the table. As you try to tab past the table in IE8, a JS error will be thrown.

The tab key should not select elements, it should move the cursor to the next cell.
fields.summary: IE8 only - Trying to tab into a table generates an exception

fields.description:
You can reproduce the issue by inserting a link manually or by pasting a JIRA issue URL:

# Paste into a wiki page an URL of a JIRA issue. Awesome Paste will kick in and convert it to a JIRA issue macro. The page displays the JIRA issue macro correctly.
# Go to JIRA's dashboard page and locate the corresponding Activity Stream feed. We will see the display there looks strange - there are repetitive icons in front and at the rear of the issue link.

The problem is that the common.css styles are not available in the Activity stream, so the background-repeat and padding-left (for example) are not being set correctly on the rendered spans with icons.
fields.summary: JIRA link in Confluence is missing CSS in JIRA Activity stream
Long words fail to wrap in PDF export

fields.description:
h3. Symptom 
When I add a large image (for example, 2000px width) to my page and I try to change its width using the custom image size UI, it won't let me enter a pixel size larger than 900px (for example, 1200px).

h3. Workaround
Resize the image to the desired size in an image manipulation program. Insert the image and do not attempt to modify the size in Confluence, and it will display in the desired size. The image will only have an upper bound of 900px when resized within the Confluence editor.
fields.summary: Custom image size won't accept values greater than 900px

fields.description:
Chrome made a change in version 16 that interprets HTTP headers more strictly.  With this change, pages in confluence that have a comma character (,) in the page title will no longer export to PDF.  Instead, the following error is displayed:
{quote}Duplicate headers received from server
The response from the server contained duplicate headers. This problem is generally the result of a misconfigured website or proxy. Only the website or proxy administrator can fix this issue.
Error 349 (net::ERR_RESPONSE_HEADERS_MULTIPLE_CONTENT_DISPOSITION): Multiple Content-Disposition headers received. This is disallowed to protect against HTTP response splitting attacks.{quote}

A screenshot of a Fiddler HTTP Header capture is attached and I've highlighted the line that includes the comma.

Please see this Chromium ticket for more information: http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=103618

To reproduce this problem:
# Create a new page with any title that includes a comma. _Test, page_ will work
# Export that page to PDF using Chrome v16
#- The error displays here
fields.summary: Export page to PDF fails in Chrome v16 when page title includes comma character

fields.description:
h2. Problem

In "Recently Updated Dashboard" macro, when selecting the last tab "Space Categories", you should get a dropdown menu of all space categories (space labels), but, instead, you see just:
 ”_This tab shows recently updated content for the selected space category. Mark some spaces with a category and select the category to see updates from the selected space category appear here_.”

h2. How to replicate

Selecting a Space Category label from the Space Category tab, which contains empty content.

Example:
# Have 2 spaces, for example, Space1 and Space2
# Give both spaces different space category by going to Space Tool > Overview > Edit Space Category, for example "One" and "Two" respectively.
# Create blogposts in Space 2
# Create a page in a Space 1 > Add the Recently Updated Dashboard macro into the page > Edit the "content type" of the macro to "blogpost" > Save the page
# Open the Space Categories tab of the dashboard
# On the dropdown menu, choose "One" 

h2. Expected behavior
There are nothing displayed, as there are no blogpost in this page.
Drop down list is still available to choose other space categories

h2. Actual behavior
There are nothing displayed, as there are no blogpost in this page.
Drop down list is gone, and not available to choose other space categories

h2. Known workarounds:

h5. Workaround 1
 # Add a (test) space that is visible to at least the user who has the problem.
 # Add all space category labels to that space.
 # Edit a page on that space.
 #* Or if the "Recently Updated Dashboard" macro has been set to only display, e.g., "comments", add a comment there.

h5. Workaround 2
Wait for a minute or so and then hit "Refresh" (F5) on the browser

h5. Workaround 3
The space displayed in the drop-down needs to have an update made so it has recently updated content

h5. Workaround 4
Check if the last chosen label has been removed?
fields.summary: Recently updated dashboard space categories drop down vanishes after selecting empty category
Shift-enter in a bullet list inside a macro box scrolls the browser

fields.description:
*Problem*

If there exist a directory in LDAP with same tree structure differing only in *case* and sometimes with *blank spaces*, then there will be partial importation of entries during synchronization. Here is a scenario to depict:

{code}2012-01-27 12:00:00,100 DEBUG [QuartzScheduler_Worker-7] [atlassian.crowd.directory.SpringLDAPConnector] findEntityByDN Entity DN <uid=User1,ou=People,o=sevenSeas,dc=Example,dc=Com> is outside the entity base DN subtree scope <uid=user1,ou=people,o=sevenseas,dc=example,dc=com>{code}

#  For example a tree with the following structure results in a situation where user1,user2 and user3 will be synchronized succesfully which is perfect:
{noformat}
cn=user1,ou=people,o=sevenSeas,dc=example,dc=com
cn=user2,ou=people,o=sevenSeas,dc=example,dc=com
cn=user3, ou=people,o=sevenSeas, dc=example, dc=com
{noformat}
# If the subtree differes a little bit and the base DN is defined as ou=people,o=sevenSeas,dc=example,dc=com, then only user1 and user2 will be synchronized
{noformat}
cn=user1,ou=people,o=sevenSeas,dc=example,dc=com
cn=user2,ou=people,o=sevenSeas,dc=example,dc=com
cn=user3,ou=PEOPLE,o=sevenSeas,dc=example,dc=com
{noformat}

h4. Update
There is a patch available for 3.5.17!
# Download the patch attached to this issue.
# Replace the JAR file by the same name in <confluence-install>confluence/WEB-INF/lib.
# Restart Confluence.
fields.summary: CASE-SENSITIVE  DN causes partial synchronization of LDAP membership.

fields.description:
When editing text inside a "Notes" box, I find that pressing Control-Shift-LeftArrow does not, as expected, select the word in preceding the cursor. Instead it selects to the beginning of the line (just like Shift-Home).

Outside of the Notes box, it works fine.

If I have a bulleted/numbered list inside the Notes box, then Control-Shift-LeftArrow *does* work correctly inside the list, suggesting the bug is specific to "normal" text inside the Notes box.

It also seems to be a problem inside an "Info" box, or a "Column" macro, suggesting it's related to macro boxes in general and not limited to Notes.
fields.summary: Shift-Control-Left inside a macro box selects to beginning-of-line

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24513].
  {panel}

Uploading and inserting an image with Ctrl+V is a great feature and I hope it can be better.

The uploaded image is named automatically, not a bad idea, however, I find it very often I prefer to name the image explicitly. Imagine, if I later find an error or missing point in my uploaded image and want to replace that image with a new one, then, how can I easily tell from the attachment list which image is to be updated(assume there are 10 images in a article).

Further more, naming images with meaningful name helps us find concerning images by full text search, right?

So, I suggest giving a chance to user to type in a file name after Ctrl+V, then click OK to confirm that file name. This file name can be pre-populated with your auto generated time-based name, so for those who don't care, they just click OK or press Enter to accept the default. Better, if the typed in name already exists, give a message box asking whether user wants to override the old image.

I believe most Confluence content contributors should be aware that there is a file name(instead of a mysterious black hole) under the hood supporting an "inline" image, therefore, don't be afraid to clarify the fact that user must assign a file name every time they Ctrl+V an new image.
fields.summary: Give opportunity to change the name of an image when using Ctrl+V to upload an image
